Dear Tori Michelle Benden:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909

questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (517) 243-9743.
Sincerely,

Section (4) A person with ongoing duties shall have both of the following:

Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Staff 1 allegedly is involved in providing a phone with sexually
explicit material on it, to Youth A.
Investigation On 2/27/24, I spoke to Administrator pertaining to the
allegations. Administrator reported they had found a phone in the
facility bathroom. This bathroom is used by the residents. The
phone was in the ceiling tiles of the bathroom. They were unable
to gain access to the contents of the phone therefore the phone
was provided to the police on 12/11/23. They discovered the
owner of the phone on 12/11/23. Administrator reported she had a
phone conversation with the police on 2/21/24 concerning the
material on the phone and filed a complaint on 2/23/24. It was
determined the phone did belong to Staff 1 and the material was
provided by her to Youth A. The phone was being used by Staff 1
2

to communicate with Youth A. Administrator reported Staff 1 has
always been a good staff member, and this was surprising to find.
Administrator reported Youth A is not in the facility anymore but at
the Calhoun County Adult Jail for his previous convictions. Staff 1
is no longer working at the facility. Her final date of employment
was 12/13/23. Staff 1 left due to other job opportunities.
Administrator provided the phone number of Staff 1 and
documentation pertaining to the incident. On 8/28/24,
Administrator reported there were no other youth at the facility that
were “present” for the allegations.
Due to the Calhoun County Sherrif Department’s involvement,
contacts were not allowed to be made with staff or youth until
permission was given by the law enforcement department.
Contact was maintained by this consultant with Sherrif 1 from
March 2024-July 2024 to receive updates on the case. On April
16, 2024, Sherrif 1 reported attempts could be made to contact
Staff 1. A contact was attempted on 4/30/2024 with Staff 1, but
the current number was no longer in service. I contacted
Administrator and she did not have any other ways to contact Staff
1.
On 5/13/24, Sherrif 1 reported not to conduct any other attempts
until the prosecuting attorney decided how to proceed.
On 7/15/24, Administrator reported there would be no pending
charges against Staff 1. An email from the prosecuting attorney’s
office was forwarded for review containing this information, which
permitted consultant involvement. Administrator reported Youth A
was no longer at the Calhoun County Jail, and she did not have
knowledge of his whereabouts or phone number.
On 7/15/24 and 8/30/24, I attempted to contact Youth A with the
phone number on his initial intake form, but to no avail.
Document Review:
The following documents were received throughout the
course of the investigation:
• Incident Report: Incident report written by Administrator
summarized activities on 12/9/23 and 12/11/23. On
12/9/23: Youth A was acting suspicious and taking 30
minutes in the bathroom. A search of the bathroom was
completed but nothing was found. On 12/11/23,
maintenance was requested to search the bathroom and
3

found an Apple iPhone in the ductwork of the ventilation
system. Along with the phone were numerous green
coupons belonging to Youth A (positive reinforcement
coupons from the facility programming) as well as paper
towels. Marshall police department was contacted but they
were unable to open the phone. The sim card was taken
out and the IT department was able to trace the number
and determined it to be the number of Staff 1. The phone
was ziplocked and given to the Calhoun County Sheriff’s
Department.
• Personnel File of Staff 1: Staff 1 was hired on 11/22/21.
All training was up to date and compliant with licensing
rules. All clearances were completed and up to date. Staff 1
did not have discipline in her file.
• Calhoun County Sheriff’s Department Police report:
Case Number 23-005024: Staff 1 was interviewed and
reported she met with Youth A’s sister and brought a phone
that belonged to Youth A’s sister into the facility for the
purpose of giving it to Youth A. Staff 1 reported she did give
it to Youth A. Staff 1 reported she also was receiving emails
and text messages from Youth A, although she reported
she didn’t know why she was receiving these emails and
texts. Staff 1 reported she was raped by Youth A five to six
times in the facility. Staff 1 reported she did not report this
to anyone because Youth A had threatened her life.
Staff 1’s Facebook account was searched by the police. On
10/17/23, she wrote to Youth A’s sister: “hey your bother
told me to get ahold of you…hey so I’m supposed to meet
up and grab something for him?”. Staff 1 reported to police
this was to obtain the cell phone to give to Youth A.
Photos were reviewed from the phone that was found in the
bathroom at the facility and Staff 1’s personal phone. These
photos were of Staff 1 and sexual in nature. They included
Staff 1 inserting something into her vagina, masturbating,
performing fellatio on a white male subject, and modeling
lingerie. These photos and videos were on Staff 1’s
personal phone and on the phone hidden in the facility.
The phone at the facility also revealed pictures of Youth A
laying on his back clothed with a cinder block wall behind
him. Youth A had videos of himself stating sexual
comments which were sent to Staff 1’s phone. Text
messages and snapchats from the hidden phone
4

concluded Youth A was using the phone to contact Staff 1
and other people outside of the facility.
There were no threatening texts or videos from Youth A to
Staff 1 on the phones.
Staff 1 acknowledged in her interview with the police she
had obtained a marijuana vape and brought that device into
the facility, giving it to Youth A.
Video Review:
• Video at the facility on 12/4/23 from 8:32pm-8:38pm, show
Staff 1 and Youth A alone going into a stairwell together.
They were in the stairwell for approximately four minutes.
Analysis The agency is noncompliant with this rule. Staff 1 does not have
the ability to provide care and supervision to juveniles in a
treatment facility due to the following:
• Staff 1 provided Youth A with a cell phone.
• Staff 1 provided Youth A with marijuana.
• Staff 1 sent sexually explicit photos and videos to Youth A
from her personal phone to the hidden phone at the facility.
• Staff 1 received photos and videos from Youth A.
• Staff 1 contacted Youth A’s personal family in order to
provide contraband to Youth A.
• Staff 1 admitted to entering into a stairwell with Youth A
and video confirms she was alone with Youth A in the
stairwell.
Conclusion VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
5

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.
